Resistance from teachers: Some teachers may be resistant to change and may not be willing to adapt to the new curriculum.
Lack of training: Teachers may not have received adequate training to teach the new curriculum, leading to confusion and inefficiency in the classroom.
Curriculum compatibility: The new curriculum may not be compatible with existing textbooks, software, or other resources, causing difficulties in implementation.
Inadequate support for students with special needs: The new curriculum may not address the needs of all students, particularly those with special needs, leading to exclusion and inadequate education.
Lack of parental involvement: Parents may not be informed or involved in the implementation of the new curriculum, leading to a lack of support and understanding at home.
